title: Meters - compare meters when R and 2R are swapped

content.question: Two circuits, Circuit <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Circuit <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, are shown in the figure. The circuits are identical except for the placement of resistors with resistances <math alttext="2 R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></math>, <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>, and <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>. Which of the following correctly compares the currents <math alttext="I sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="I sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> in ammeters <math alttext="A sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>A</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="A sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>A</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, respectively, as well as the voltmeter readings <math alttext="V sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="V sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="I sub 1 is greater than I sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="V sub 1 is greater than V sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="I sub 1 is greater than I sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="V sub 1 equals V sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="I sub 2 is greater than I sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="V sub 1 is greater than V sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="I sub 2 is greater than I sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="V sub 1 equals V sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="I sub 1 is greater than I sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="V sub 1 equals V sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
